questions.question: Investing in your child's education is a wise strategy that will pay ............................... in the long run.
questions.description: When something pays off, the end result is good.

questions.question: It took him so many years to pay ...................................... his student loan.
questions.description: To pay off a loan is to clear a debt.

questions.question: I paid ...................................... the odds when I went shopping for shoes yesterday.
questions.description: To pay over the odds is to pay much more than usual.

questions.question: The boy was warned that if he misbehaved in the class, he would have to pay ....................................
questions.description: To pay the piper is to bear the consequences of doing something wrong.

questions.question: I paid through the ........................................ when I got the roof repaired.
questions.description: To pay through the nose is to pay a lot more money than usual.

questions.question: At last my roommate agreed to pay ....................................
questions.description: To pay up is to pay your share of the bill.

questions.question: The boy was denied treatment because his parents couldn't pay .......................................
questions.description: To pay upfront is to pay in advance.

questions.question: 8 . She had to pay .......................................... hundreds of dollars for her treatment.
questions.description: To pay out is to pay a large sum of money from your funds.

questions.question: You haven't paid me my money ............................................
questions.description: To pay back is to give someone the amount of money you borrowed from them.

questions.question: I will buy the tickets but you have to pay ..................................... the drinks.
Pay …………………………. your mortgage as soon as possible.
questions.description: To pay off a loan is to give someone all the money you owe them.
